description: Number of strings on n symbols in Stockhausen problem.
references: R. C. Read, Combinatorial problems in theory of music, Discrete Math. 167 (1997), 543-551.
Read, Ronald C. and Yen, Lily, A note on the Stockhausen problem, J. Comb. Theory, Ser. A 76, No. 1, 1-10.
formula: a(n) = (2*n^2-5*n+4)*a(n-1) + (-4*n^2+15*n-14)*a(n-2) + (2*n^2-10*n+12)*a(n-3).a(n) = hypergeom([1, 1/2, -n], [], -2). - _Vladeta Jovovic_, Apr 08 2007a(n) = (1/2^n) * Integral_{x=0..infinity} (2+x^2)^n*exp(-x) dx. - _Gerald McGarvey_, Oct 12 2007a(n) ~ sqrt(Pi) * 2^(n+1) * n^(2*n+1/2) / exp(2*n). - _Vaclav Kotesovec_, Feb 18 2015
author: _Lily Yen_
